info.title: Monogenic Diabetes (MD) Data Dictionary
info.name: md_v1.0
info.description: The MD data dictionary is a consensus data schema built by an international group of monogenic diabetes experts and maintained by Data for the Common Good (D4CG) at the University of Chicago in collaboration with the PREDICT Consortium. It is based on the collective requirements of its contributors.

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

DATA_CONTRIBUTOR_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
DATA_CONTRIBUTOR_ID.description: An identifier assigned to a data contributor.

DATA_SOURCE.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
DATA_SOURCE.description: Indicates where the data is originating from

LAST_KNOWN_SURVIVAL_STATUS.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
LAST_KNOWN_SURVIVAL_STATUS.description: The last known survival status of the subject.

Alive.description: Showing characteristics of life; displaying signs of life.

Unknown.description: Reported as unknown by the data contributor.

AGE_LAST_CONTACT.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
AGE_LAST_CONTACT.description: The age of the subject at last contact.
implementation_notes: Only applicable for survey source data

AGE_LAST_CONTACT_UNIT.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
AGE_LAST_CONTACT_UNIT.description: The unit used by the numeric AGE_AT_LAST_CONTACT field.

AGE_LAST_CONTACT_PRECISION.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
AGE_LAST_CONTACT_PRECISION.description: Indicates whether a recorded AGE_AT_LAST_CONTACT is exact or just an approximation.

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

TIMEPOINT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
TIMEPOINT.description: Indicates the diabetes diagnosis event of the subject

AGE_AT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_AT.description: The age of the subject at the diagnois event
implementation_notes: For reporting at the time of birth, report 1 day

AGE_UNIT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_UNIT.description: The unit of the age of the subject at the diagnosis event

AGE_PRECISION.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_PRECISION.description: The precision of the age of the subject at the diagnosis event

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

RELATION_HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
RELATION_HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The honest broker subject ID of this family member (if also a subject in the data commons)

RELATION.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
RELATION.description: The relation of this family member to the patient.

CONDITION.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
CONDITION.description: The relevant condition from the family member's medical history.

SOURCE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
SOURCE.description: The source used to determine the family member's condition.

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

SEX.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
SEX.description: The biological sex of the subject assigned at birth.

ETHNICITY.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost

RACE.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost

American Indian or Alaska Native.description: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment

Asian.description: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam

Black or African American.description: A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa

Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islande.description: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands

White.description: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

AGE_AT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_AT.description: The age of the subject at diagnosis for the condition.

AGE_UNIT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_UNIT.description: The unit of the age of the subject at diagnosis for the condition.

AGE_PRECISION.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_PRECISION.description: The precision of the of the age of the subject at diganosis for the condition

CONDITION.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available

implementation_notes: Only select "Other" if the condition is not related to the provided list (which are designated as "of interest" by the PREDICT group).

CONDITION_OTHER.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available

CONDITION_CODE.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
CONDITION_CODE.description: The code that describes the condition.
implementation_notes: If you have a more specific form of a condition listed above, select the condition from the list and use this field to provide the more specific coded value. Do not use the "Other" value.

CODE_SYSTEM.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
CODE_SYSTEM.description: The code system used to define the CONDITION_CODE.

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

AGE_AT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_AT.description: The age of the subject at the biometric measurement.

AGE_UNIT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_UNIT.description: The unit of the age of the subject at the biometric measurement

AGE_PRECISION.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_PRECISION.description: The precision of the age of the subject at the biometric measurement

MEASUREMENT_TYPE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
MEASUREMENT_TYPE.description: The type of general biometric measurement.

MEASUREMENT_NUMERIC.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
MEASUREMENT_NUMERIC.description: The numeric value of the general biometric measurement.

MEASUREMENT_UNIT.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
MEASUREMENT_UNIT.description: The units for the numeric VALUE recorded for the subject's general biometric measurement.

implementation_notes: Use percentile as a unit when reporting pediatric BMI

Z_SCORE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
Z_SCORE.description: Z-score associated with BMI value as applicable

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

SAMPLE_TYPE.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
SAMPLE_TYPE.description: The type of sample available available for the subject

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

AGE_AT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_AT.description: The age of the subject when the genetic test was completed

AGE_UNIT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_UNIT.description: The unit of the age of the subject when the genetic test was completed

AGE_PRECISION.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_PRECISION.description: The precision of the age of the subject when the genetic test was completed

CAUSITIVE_ALTERATION.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
CAUSITIVE_ALTERATION.description: Is this genetic alteration a cause for the subject's diabetes?

STATUS.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
STATUS.description: Is the genetic alteration present or absent?
implementation_notes: Can use this field and select "Absent" to indicate if a subject tested negative for a particular genetic variant

SAMPLE_TYPE.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
SAMPLE_TYPE.description: The type of sample used for this genetic analysis.

LABORATORY_NAME.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
LABORATORY_NAME.description: The name of the laboratory that processed the specimen.

METHOD.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
METHOD.description: The testing method/technique used to generate the observed results.
implementation_notes: Note: For cases where confirmatory testing was performed, this field should  be used to indicate the method of the initial test, not the confirmatory testing method.

Karyotyping.description: The assessment of the chromosomal morphology and number in somatic cells of an individual.

Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization.description: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.

RT-PCR.description: A laboratory procedure in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification. Transcribing an RNA strand into a DNA complement is termed reverse transcription and is done by the enzyme reverse transcriptase.

PCR.description: A laboratory procedure in which an RNA strand is first transcribed into a DNA complement and then subjected to PCR amplification. Transcribing an RNA strand into a DNA complement is termed reverse transcription and is done by the enzyme reverse transcriptase.

MLPA.description: A type of high-throughput, multiplex PCR method used to determine abnormal DNA copy number changes of up to 50 genomic DNA or RNA sequences with a single pair of PCR primers. It is frequently used in the detection of genetic aberrations in tumors, and can distinguish sequences differing in only a single nucleotide.

Sequencing, NGS, Whole Genome.description: A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for all of the exons in an individual.

Sequencing, NGS, Whole Exome.description: A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for nearly the entire genome of an individual.

Sequencing, NGS, Single Gene DNA.description: A genomic test that sequences all the exons of a particular gene. (Source: PCDC)

Sequencing, NGS, Targeted DNA.description: A DNA sequencing technique in which selected regions of an individual's genome are sequenced. (Source: NCIt)

Sequencing, NGS, Targeted RNA.description: A type of whole transcriptome shotgun sequencing technique in which select portions of the transcriptome are selected for sequencing. (Source: NCIt)

Sequencing, NGS, Total RNA.description: A procedure that can determine the nucleotide sequence for all of the RNA transcripts in an individual. (Source: NCIt)

Sequencing, NGS, NOS.description: The determination of the sequence of component residues in a macromolecule, e.g. amino acids in a protein or nucleotide bases in DNA/RNA or the computational analysis performed to determine the similarities between nonidentical proteins or molecules of DNA or RNA.

Sequencing, Methylation Array.description: The use of a high-throughput microarray where all of the known CpG islands either in a single specimen or all of the known promoter sequences of a specimen or a population group are coupled to beads or microwells to determine which are methylated.

Sequencing, Nanostring.description: Nanostring is an amplification-free technology that measures nucleic acid content by counting molecules directly. (Source: https://www.genetics.pitt.edu)

SNP Array.description: A genomic microarray-based method able to detect single nucleotide polymorphisms.

Array CGH.description: Array Comparative Genomic Hybridization (aCGH) is a microarray-based technique to detect alterations in Genomic DNA sequence. (Source: Oxford Gene Technology)

Genotyping, NOS.description: The determination of the DNA sequence of an individual.

Cytogenetics, NOS.description: The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.

Other.description: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Unknown.description: Reported as unknown by the data contributor.

CYTOGENETIC_LOCATION.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
CYTOGENETIC_LOCATION.description: The chromosome on which the observed mutation is located.

GENE.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
GENE.description: A gene targeted for mutation analysis, identified in HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) notation.

ALTERATION_TYPE.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
ALTERATION_TYPE.description: The type of variation detected by this genetic analysis.

ALTERATION_EFFECT.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
ALTERATION_EFFECT.description: The downstream effects of a genetic alteration.

ALTERATION_REGION.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
ALTERATION_REGION.description: Regions of interest where a genetic alteration may occur.

HGVS_ACC.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available

HGVS_CODING.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
HGVS_CODING.description: If this alteration is described at the sequence/chromosome level, this is its representation in HGVS nomenclature (cHGVS).

HGVS_PROTEIN.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
HGVS_PROTEIN.description: If this alteration is described at the translational product level, this is its representation in HGVS nomenclature (pHGVS)

HGVS_GENOMIC.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
HGVS_GENOMIC.description: If this alteration is described at the genome level, this is its representation in HGVS nomenclature (gHGVS)

ISCN.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
ISCN.description: An international standard for human chromosome nomenclature, which includes band names, symbols and abbreviated terms used in the description of human chromosome and chromosome abnormalities.

REPORTED_SIGNIFICANCE.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
REPORTED_SIGNIFICANCE.description: The initial reported ACMG clinical significance of this genetic variation.

Pathogenic.description: A genetic variant that is known to directly contribute to the development of disease.

Likely pathogenic.description: A genetic variant that is known to have a high likelihood (greater than 90% certainty) to contribute to the development of a disease.

Uncertain significance.description: A variation in a genetic sequence whose association with disease risk is unknown.

Likely benign.description: A genetic variant that is not expected to contribute to the development of a disease, but the scientific evidence may be insufficient to prove this conclusively.

Benign.description: A genetic variant that is known to not contribute to the development of a disease.

Unknown.description: Reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ALLELIC_STATE.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
ALLELIC_STATE.description: The specific combination of alleles (gene variants) that an individual possesses at a particular genetic locus (location on a chromosome). Alleles are different forms of a gene that can code for different traits or characteristics. Each person inherits one allele for a given gene from their biological mother and one allele from their biological father, forming a pair of alleles at that locus.

MAF_NUMERIC.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
MAF_NUMERIC.description: The incidence of this mutation in the sample (%).

MOSAICISM.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
MOSAICISM.description: Does this subject have two or more genetically different sets of cells in their body?

EXTERNAL_REF_ID.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
EXTERNAL_REF_ID.description: An ID to an external knowledge base that holds additional information about this genetic variant.

EXTERNAL_REF_ID_SYSTEM.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
EXTERNAL_REF_ID_SYSTEM.description: The name of the external knowledge base from which the EXTERNAL_REF_ID is drawn.

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

AGE_AT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost

AGE_UNIT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_UNIT.description: The unit used by the numeric AGE_AT.

AGE_PRECISION.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_PRECISION.description: Indicates whether a recorded AGE_UNIT is exact or just an approximation.

TEST_TYPE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
TEST_TYPE.description: The type of test being administered to/by the subject.
implementation_notes: Please report relevant labs at time points of dx, highest ever, most recent, and any other time periods you have bandwidth to report.
For example, could report Blood Glucose value at time of dx, highest ever, and most recent. But do not necessarily need to report all values in the EMR

METHOD.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
METHOD.description: A systematic course of action that is performed in order to complete a laboratory test.

MEASUREMENT_TYPE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
MEASUREMENT_TYPE.description: The type of measurement for the indicated test.

RESULT_MODIFIER.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available

RESULT_NUMERIC.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available

RESULT_UNIT.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
RESULT_UNIT.description: The unit used to report the result.

REFERENCE_RANGE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
REFERENCE_RANGE.description: The range or specific value that indicates a normal result for this test

RESULT_INTERPRETATION.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
RESULT_INTERPRETATION.description: The categorical result of the test administered to/by the subject.

FASTING_STATUS.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
FASTING_STATUS.description: What was the fasting status of the subject when the test was performed.

POST_GLUCOSE_TIMEPOINT.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
POST_GLUCOSE_TIMEPOINT.description: How long between glucose administration and blood glucose measurement?
implementation_notes: Note: Only use for glucose tolerance testing

POST_GLUCOSE_TIMEPOINT_UNIT.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
POST_GLUCOSE_TIMEPOINT_UNIT.description: The unit of time used to measure the time between glucose administration and blood glucose measurement.
implementation_notes: Note: Only use for glucose tolerance testing

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

AGE_AT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_AT.description: The age of the subject at the indicated reference timepoint.

AGE_UNIT.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_UNIT.description: The unit used by the numeric AGE_AT.

AGE_PRECISION.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_PRECISION.description: Indicates whether a recorded AGE_AT is exact or just an approximation.

DIABETES_STATUS.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
DIABETES_STATUS.description: Has the subject ever had a diagnosis of gestational diabetes, prediabtes, or diabetes?

HYPOGLYCEMIA_FREQUENCY.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
HYPOGLYCEMIA_FREQUENCY.description: How often has the subject had MILD/MODERATE hypoglycemia (low blood sugars around 70 mg/dl and not associated with seizures or loss of consciousness)?

SEVERE_HYPOGLYCEMIA_FREQUENCY.tier: 3 - contributors shouldn't prioritize inclusion, but can include if resources are available
SEVERE_HYPOGLYCEMIA_FREQUENCY.description: How often has the subject had SEVERE hypoglycemia (low blood sugar)? For children (under 18 years old), this means they were partially or completely unconscious and/or having seizures. For adults (over 18 years old), this means they were partially or completely unconscious and/or having seizures and/or otherwise not able to help with their own care.

DKA.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
DKA.description: Has the subject had diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) ?

TIME_IN_RANGE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
TIME_IN_RANGE.description: The percentage of time the subject was within target glucose range on a CGM report

CGM_RANGE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
CGM_RANGE.description: Indicates the glucose range value parameters on a CGM report

DIET.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
DIET.description: Since the subject's initial diagnosis of diabetes or high blood sugars, has the subject substantially changed what they eat, how much they eat, or when they eat, to try to reach 'goal' blood sugars?

EXERCISE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
EXERCISE.description: Since the subject's initial diagnosis of diabetes or high blood sugars, has the subject substantially changed how much movement (exercise) they do, to try to reach 'goal' blood sugars?

HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
HONEST_BROKER_SUBJECT_ID.description: The identifier assigned to the subject by the honest broker--an individual, organization or system acting for, or on behalf of, a covered entity to collect and provide health information to research investigators in such a manner whereby it would not be reasonably possible for the investigators or others to identify the corresponding patients-subjects directly or indirectly. The honest broker cannot be one of the investigators. The information provided to the investigators by the honest broker may incorporate linkage codes to permit information collation and/or subsequent inquiries (i.e., a "re-identification code"), however the information linking this re-identification code to the patient's identity must be retained by the honest broker and subsequent inquiries are conducted through the honest broker. (Source: NCI Thersaurus)

AGE_AT_START.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
AGE_AT_START.description: The age of the subject when they started the regimen that includes the medication indicated by the MEDICATION field.

AGE_AT_STOP.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
AGE_AT_STOP.description: The age of the subject when they stopped the regimen that includes the medication indicated by the MEDICATION field.

AGE_UNIT.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
AGE_UNIT.description: The unit used by the numeric AGE_AT_START and AGE_AT_STOP fields.

AGE_PRECISION.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
AGE_PRECISION.description: Indicates whether a recorded AGE_AT is exact or just an approximation.

REASON_STOP.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
REASON_STOP.description: The reason the planned treatment has stopped.

DM_MEDICATION_CLASS.tier: 1 - contributors must include, regardless of the resource cost
DM_MEDICATION_CLASS.description: The type of diabetes medication used to treat the subject.

MEDICATION_CLASS_OTHER.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
MEDICATION_CLASS_OTHER.description: Type of other medicaiton of interest.

MEDICATION_NAME.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
MEDICATION_NAME.description: Name of the medication indicated by MEDICATION_CLASS field

MEDICATION_CODE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available

MEDICATION_CONCENTRATION.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available

MEDICATION_DOSE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
MEDICATION_DOSE.description: The dose of the medication indicated by the MEDICATION_NAME field.

MEDICATION_UNIT.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
MEDICATION_UNIT.description: Units of the medication indicated by MEDICATION_NAME field

FREQUENCY.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
FREQUENCY.description: Frequency the subject administered the medication indicated by the MEDICATION field

ROUTE.tier: 2 - contributors should priotritize inclusion if resources are available
ROUTE.description: The route by which the medication indicated by the MEDICATION field is administered.
